page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA.
page.content: Down St Mary is a small village surrounded by countryside. There are many roads leading to it, the main one winding up from Morchard Road. In Down St Mary there is a church and a Post Office which also sells a few foods. There is a bus shelter and village hall. In the centre of the village is a green. There are numerous fields around with several woods. Down the hill from Down St Mary there is another village called Morchard Road. That has a pub and a garage which sells food as well. It lies on the main road from Exeter to Barnstaple where the road to Torrington turns off. There is also a road to Morchard Bishop. There is an unmanned railway station at Morchard Road. Several ancient farms have survived in the area.
